TopicTitle: lets fill out infrastructure b4 the solar system

Articles.Content:
I love 1.7 with all the planets and such, but I hope they don't ad anymore. I want a fully flushed system to explore when theres goals and consequencies, lets bring it back to kerbal and discuss the reason why we go into space in the first place (lets flush out the rewards system)

Is it:

Money?, morale?, fame?, a race?, conquest?, or survival?

Fun. It's fun.

I agree. But it would be interesting if there where other countries and such to deal with on kerbin that would have their own space program and get pissed at you when you land your capsules in their territory.

I agree. But it would be interesting if there where other countries and such to deal with on kerbin that would have their own space program and get pissed at you when you land your capsules in their territory.

And unless you do something amazing, the government takes away your funds.
I think a campaign can wait until we have more... infrastructure... like docking, real missions to perform on EVA/IVA, stock payloads to deliver to orbit, a working aerodynamic model, etc.
I dunno... I can't imagine anyone playing now and landing a rocket on Kerbin and then sighing loudly. "Man, I wish somebody got pissed about what I just did..."

And unless you do something amazing, the government takes away your funds.

I wish this was how it worked IRL. NASA should have received billions for the Curiosity program.
It would be pretty neat to have a space race type of campaign where you would have do this or go to that before the ai does.
Or perhaps it could be more like SpaceX and there's no looming, budget restricting government over your head, you just have people pay you to launch rockets and if you don't you go bankrupt.

Is it:

Well you have to remember that this game is in alpha, at this point in development they are going to be more focused on implementing the basics and making sure everything works right.

I, and I'm sure others would agree, would much rather have a bug free game then a storyline at this point.

And like that other guy said, It's just fun.
well, why do we have(or had) a space program now(or then)?
The metaphor is to put flesh on something, you want the rewards system fully fleshed out. Flush is generally used to mean the opposite - to flush something out of a system you get rid of it.
I am happy with the current state of the Kerbal system. I don't think we need more planets yet, I would like to see more gameplay improvements first.

when did 1.7 come out?

Yeah! I didn't know we were that far in development already!
